webTitle: Guardian Camera Club: Rebecca Sharplin-Hughes' portfolio

fields.standfirst:
A review of Rebecca Sharplin-Hughes' portfolio.

These images were made at Greenham Common, a former RAF station that was finally closed in 1993, but was the scene of a Women's Peace Camp in the 1980's, and is now public parkland. The 'look' of these prints is informed by the medium format camera, and also the infrared film that's been used. In 'Building' it's that hole in the clouds, counterpointing the abandoned building, that makes the composition interesting; 'Runway' is perfectly minimal. The dramatic cloudscape of 'Landscape' is weighty; 'Missile Silo' has oddly congruent lines on the ground, and in the sky. The ominous atmosphere of 'Control Tower' and 'Missile Silo' really sums up this odd place, and this photographic style does suit it well. This is an interesting set of prints, in need of some 'spotting' of course, but in a way it's good that they're not 'digitally perfect'

fields.trailText: A review of Rebecca Sharplin-Hughes' portfolio
